actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that the identity of the manufacturer of a prescription drug appear on the label of the package from which the drug is to be dispensed.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that 180 days after enactment of this Act prescription drugs manufactured in final dosage form and distributed or packed by a different person, company, or corporation show on the label both the identity of the distributor or packer and the identity or registration number of the manufacturer.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that the identity of the manufacturer of a prescription drug appear on the label of the package from which the drug is to be dispensed.
